sentences.sContent: This new investigation shows temperature 'spikes' within some of the interglacial periods over the last 340,000 years.
sentences.sContent_eng: This new investigation shows temperature 'spikes' within some of the interglacial periods over the last 340,000 years.
sentences.sCn: 这项新的调查显示在过去的340,000年气温都“被钉在”间冰期内。

sentences.sContent: Previous analysis of ice cores has shown that the climate consists of ice ages and warmer interglacial periods roughly every 100,000 years.
sentences.sContent_eng: Previous analysis of ice cores has shown that the climate consists of ice ages and warmer interglacial periods roughly every 100,000 years.
sentences.sCn: 早先的冰芯分析显示气候的有冰龄和温暖的间冰期大致为100，000年为一个周期。

sentences.sContent: Human effects on the climate notwithstanding, the cycle will continue to turn, the interglacial will some day come to an end – and the ice sheets will descend again.
sentences.sContent_eng: Human effects on the climate notwithstanding, the cycle will continue to turn, the interglacial will some day come to an end – and the ice sheets will descend again.
sentences.sCn: 人类对于气候有一定影响，但循环将会继续下去，总有一天间冰期将会结束，到那时冰层又将卷土重来。

trans.tranOther: occurring or formed between periods of glacial action
